name: Matcha Hatsu-Mukashi, 30g Can
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. "Hatsu-Mukashi" is recommended for koicha (thick tea). It offers a deep, rich flavor that lingers on the tongue with slight bitterness. It has a complex and elegant mouthfeel.

name: Matcha Ato-Mukashi, 30g Can
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha.  "Ato-Mukashi" is recommended for koicha (thick tea). It is elegant, offering a blend of delicacy and complexity with a rich, deep flavor.

name: Matcha Hatsu-no-Mukashi, 30g Can
description: Omotesenke Jimyosai Sosho's favorite Matcha. Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha.  "Matcha Hatsu-no-Mukashi" is recommended for koicha (thick tea).

name: Matcha Seiko-no-Mukashi, 30g Can
description: Urasenke Hounsai Sosho's favorite Matcha. Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha.  "Matcha Seiko-no-Mukashi" is recommended for both usucha (thin tea) and koicha (thick tea).

name: Matcha Senun-no-Shiro,Can 30g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha.  "Senun no Shiro"  is a Thin grade matcha, We recommend preparing it as such. This tea does have strong bitterness and acidic taste to it.

name: Matcha Hiroha-no-Shiro,Can 30g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha.  Since "Hiroha no Shiro"  is a Thin grade matcha, We recommend preparing it as such. It has a subtle umami flavor, giving the Matcha a slight bitterness and acidity.

name: Matcha Wako, Can 40g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. Wako characterized by a refreshing aroma and a light, smooth finish. Recommended for making thin tea. Goes great with all kinds of confectionery.

name: Matcha Kirin, Can 40g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. Kirin, the unique refreshing, rich flavor with a smooth finish make this one of Marukyu Koyamaen’s most popular principal Matchas.

name: Matcha Isuzu, Can 40g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. Isuzu - Characterized by a good balance between a refreshing aroma, an astringent, mellow umami and a slightly bitter flavor. Recommended for making thin tea. Also perfect for mixing with milk or cream.

name: Matcha Unkaku, Can 40g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. Characterized by a soft, smooth finish, this premium-grade Matcha also has a sweet aroma and rich flavor. It’s also one of the most popular of all Marukyu Koyamaen’s principal Matchas.Suitable for making both thick and thin teas.
